metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33621 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The cgi gem before 0.1.0.2, 0.2.x before 0.2.2, and 0.3.x before 0.3.5 for Ruby allows HTTP response splitting. This is relevant to applications that use untrusted user input either to generate an HTTP response or to create a CGI::Cookie object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33621` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.8
ruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jruby package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
ruby2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-5ubuntu1.8').
